title: Colm Tucker
text:
Colm Tucker (22 September 1952 – 11 January 2012) was an international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He toured <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a> in 1980 with the <a href="British%20and%20Irish%20Lions">British Lions</a> during a period when at club level he was representing <a href="Shannon%20RFC">Shannon RFC</a>. Tucker was educated at <a href="St.%20Munchin%27s%20College">St. Munchin's College</a> in Limerick.
Colm Tucker had the ‘misfortune’ to have his surname misprinted in the programme for the international against France in Paris in 1980.
Tucker's death was announced in January 2012. He was 59.
